History</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social history - History</topcClas>         <topcClas>Population censuses - Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The Integrated Census Microdata (I-CeM) project has produced a standardised, integrated dataset of most of the censuses of Great Britain for the period 1851 to 1911: England and Wales for 1851-1861, 1881-1911; Scotland for 1851-1901, making available to academic researchers the detailed information on parish-level about everyone resident in this country collected at each decennial census from 1851 to 1911 during a period of profound social change.<br> <br> The original digital data has been coded and standardised. In addition, the original text and numerical strings have always been preserved in separate variables, so that researchers can go back to the original transcription.<br> <br> Further information can be found on the project webpage at: <a href= "https://www.essex.ac.uk/history/research/icem/default.htm" title="Integrated Census Microdata">https://www.essex.ac.uk/history/research/icem/default.htm</a><br> <br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1851-01-01T00:00:00Z">1851</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="1911-01-01T00:00:00Z">1911</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="2009-01-01T00:00:00Z">2009</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2014-01-01T00:00:00Z">2014</collDate>         <nation>Channel Islands</nation>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <nation>Isle of Man</nation>         <geogUnit>Counties</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Parishes (Civil)</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Inhabitants of England, Wales, Scotland, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man</universe>         <dataKind>Textual data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Alpha/numeric data</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>No sampling (total universe)</sampProc>         <deviat>1851: 20610325, 1861: 22837316, 1871: 3349656, 1881: 29865602, 1891: 33522822, 1901: 36931736, 1911: 36353455</deviat>         <collMode>Transcription of existing materials; Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>Digital transcriptions of the original data, provided by <a href="http://www.findmypast.co.uk/" title="FindMyPast">FindMyPast</a></dataSrc>         </sources>         <ConOps>None</ConOps>         <weight>No weighting used</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>History Data Service, UK Data Archive</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Third party access conditions apply</specPerm>         <restrctn>Data is available online at <a href="http://icem.data-archive.ac.uk/" target="_blank">Integrated Census Microdata</a> and <a href=" http://icem-nesstar.data-archive.ac.uk/webview/" target="_blank">ICeM-Nesstar.</a> </restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>4177 1881 Census for England and Wales, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man (Enhanced Version) </relStdy>       <relStdy>4178 1881 Census for Scotland </relStdy>       <relPubl>Sch\ufffd\ufffdrer, K.
